Package snake

Class Grid

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grid

        public Grid​(int nRows,
            int nCols)
        This is the constructor of the Grid Object. A grid is initialized with a certain number of rows and columns. It is then filled with spaces (" ") to avoid null in the toString() method.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method allows to display the gaming grid as a string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The grid as a String. The grid represents the gaming area where the snake will move. The grid is surrounded by plus signs and cells are separated by spaces.

      • pointInsideGrid

        public boolean pointInsideGrid​(int y,
                               int x)
        This method checks if a point is in the game grid or not.
        Returns:
        True or False, depending on wether a point which coordinates are passed as arguments is into the game grid.

      • placeObject

        public void placeObject​(int y,
                        int x,
                        java.lang.String o)
        Place a specified caracter at a particular address in the grid.

      • dropBlock

        public void dropBlock​(int y,
                      int x)
        Place a caracter "#" at a particular address in the grid. In a snake game "#" are walls. On collision, the snake dies and game is over.

      • dropFood

        public void dropFood​(int y,
                     int x)
        Place a caracter "o" at a particular address in the grid. In a snake game "o" are apples, making the snake size grow.

      • getCell

        public java.lang.String getCell​(int y,
                                int x)
        Usual getter to access private data of the Grid object.
        Returns:
        The string contained in a particuliar adress in the grid.

      • getGrid

        public java.lang.String[][] getGrid()
        Usual getter to access private data of the Grid object.
        Returns:
        the String[][] corresponding to the grid.

      • updateGrid

        public void updateGrid​(Snake snake)
        OLD - Update the gaming grid by erasing the snake body and, if it's still alive, placing it again.
        See Also:
        This method isn't use anymore once the first tests are passed. Replaced by updateGrids().

      • updateGrids

        public void updateGrids​(Snake snake)
        Update the gaming grid by erasing the snake body and, if it's still alive, placing it again. This method is an update of the updateGrid() and allows to take the snake size into account.

      • genIntGrid

        public int[][] genIntGrid()
        This method generate a grid filled with int which size is the same as the gaming grid. This grid is used to manage the snake size.

      • decrIntGrid

        public void decrIntGrid()
        Working together with genIntGrid(), this method decreases the positive int contained in the intGrid by 1.

      • getNRows

        public int getNRows()
        Usual getter to access private data of the Grid object.
        Returns:
        the number of rows.

      • getNCols

        public int getNCols()
        Usual getter to access private data of the Grid object.
        Returns:
        the number of columns.
